fullText: Bruce Willis brings surprising vulnerability to his stage debut as the tormented writer Paul Sheldon, while Laurie Metcalf is chillingly effective as his deranged captor Annie Wilkes.
dtliExcerpt: Bruce Willis brings surprising vulnerability to his stage debut as the tormented writer Paul Sheldon, while Laurie Metcalf is chillingly effective as his deranged captor Annie Wilkes.
showScoreExcerpt: Bruce Willis brings surprising vulnerability to his stage debut as the tormented writer Paul Sheldon, while Laurie Metcalf is chillingly effective as his deranged captor Annie Wilkes.
rejectionReasoning: openai: The text is a brief mention of performances without any evaluative content or overall assessment of the show.; gemini: This review refers to a production starring Bruce Willis and Laurie Metcalf, which is not the current Broadway production of Misery.
